title: Pool Party Mundo impossible to get?
body: With Day 1's results uploaded it is clear that reaching 55 MILLION points will be a near impossible task. By estimation our first day has only garnered 3.5 million, so by the 6th day our estimated points would not have even reached Level 3 rewards!! RITO PLZ, you expect too much!

replies.body: I believe the community will make it happen!

It's not gonna happen because you're forcing Solo Q players to stop playing Solo/Duo Q for a gimmicky event and that's really not gonna happen because they're all just doing 1 Pool Party game, winning it then going back to Solo Q knowing that they're now eligible for rewards.

You sir have to much faith.

The reason I see behind these requirements during pool party being so hard is because of what riot things we do. I believe riot thinks it is easy for the community to gather a group of 5 people before game and play that constantly together when truthfully a group of 2-3 people pregame is more realistic of the League of Legends community. It is nearly impossible for me to gather a group of 5 people that I know, and even though I could do what others are doing and form a group through a gathering message on a forum, it is highly possible that the group formed through that forum will be at each others throats and disperse immediately after the game is over. The average league player can easily find 1 or 2 friends and play a normals or aram but finding a 5 man group is very difficult and really sets us back. If the requirement was set to a group of 2/3 or more in a party on summoners rift, aram, or crystal scar then the requirements could be easily met in the time limit without even people realizing they were gathering points. Another thing is that you can gather points through sending gifts to other players and friends, but truth is nobody is gonna spend their money on other people. Even though that is the fastest way to gather points nobody in league ever thinks about sending a whole enemy team and their team all a skin because that is around perhaps 40 dollars a game just to get about 800 points which isn't worth it since our goals are in the millions, you would have an easier time playing 160 games of aram than spending 40 bucks. The other thing is the preconception that all league players have money to spend, a lot of league players do have jobs but there's also a large majority that are in high school, college, or are people who are still paying taxes and mortgage as well as child support. Blowing money on League just to get a free skin isn't worth it. What I'm trying to say is I believe the requirements right now are way to harsh on the community around the pre-made game and this does make the goals a bit more impossible. An easy way in my mind to fix this would be to lower the 5 point requirements from a pre-made 5 man team to a pre-made 2 man team or more because then you would still be playing with friends and having fun and this would make the points increase drastically as well as community output. Most league players play alone or with one or two other friends realistically and since summer sales on steam are going on right now even more people are away from league and playing the new games they just got.
I'm not angry at riot for making these standards a bit tough, it just proves their thoughts of us and how much they believe we work together as a community. It's just based on this being the 2nd or 3rd day and we've only just reached 5 million and need 10 million to unlock each of the next prizes it just seems a bit impossible. These are just my ideas on what could be done to keep what riot wants yet still make the goals more achievable.

Im with you tbh, i did the maths at the start, I'm not sure how many players there are but to get 5 million points (the first goal) there needs to be 1 million pre made team matches that need to WIN not just play but win, 1 million is a large amount especially seeming its so hard to make a pre made of 5 people, even if you have 4 friends that can play, chances are that at least one of them has a life and cant play when the others can or can only play 1 or 2 games which you might not even win, and thats just for the 1st goal, to get mundo there needs to be 11 million pre made wins and due to the matchmaking system premades of 5 will get matched with other premades of 5 which means that if 10 people all manage to get into teams they will only get 5 points between them so that means that to get 55 million points, 110 million people need to work together (in a game where teamwork is all but absent most of the time) 
and lets face it, most people will be unable or unwanting to get into teams so it will only be a select few people who manage to play in teams consistently enough to stack up some points.

and think about the rewards for a minute 
in ocean week the community smashed those goals, but only because we were supposed to, riot already knew they were going to make that statue, its too good publicity to not do it, and apart from the other rewards cost them nothing.

but for pool party week the final reward is a skin (and a champion if you dont have mundo) i dont know how many million people play lol but giving every single one who participates the same champion and a brand new skin is going to hurt their potential profit (as well has having a mundo in every game for the next month). The only way for it to not lose them potential profit is if all those millions of people do exactly what we are doing now and realise that achieving that goal is almost impossible and then have to pay 475 (or however much it is) for a gift to quadruple the points of playing a team game, which is I'm guessing has been the plan from the beginning hence the ability to earn points for 'team up week' by paying money when you couldn't do that in ocean week. 
so the real prize for working in a team is actually the summoner icon (and it is a cool one) 
and I'm not having a go at riot for making it too hard for us, i respect riot as a company and its just doing what any other company does, like those places where you eat for $1 on your birthday but in the fine print it says 'only if you bring 10 friends who all pay full price' its not a bad thing its just a way for them to make money in a way that gives us something to do as well.

anyway i hope riot or the community proves me wrong, but this is my prediction.
Honestly even if the community really did fail, I think the Riot team would fudge the numbers to atleast get all the unlocks to level 5 open.
hi, im sure we'll get it lol
